The range standing orders should include an Emergency Response Plan (ERP). If there are no range standing orders, then the RSO will need to ensure an ERP specific to the range is created.

 

An ERP will include:

 

•Emergency phone number (usually 9-1-1) and the location of the closest telephone (or direction for RSO to carry a cell phone);

 

•Civic address of the range, plus driving directions to the closest emergency medical facility;

 

•Key contact names and phone numbers, and a radio net diagram if applicable (e.g. when remote sentries are required);

 

•Diagram of typical layout of the range at that location, including any special instructions for set-up;

 

•Location specific hazards, restrictions, or important information about the use of the area;

 

•Evacuation protocol and form-up point; and

 

•Post-emergency procedures â€“ those required by DND policy, and any location specific requirements (e.g. how to contact the property owner, any applicable non-DND policies, etc.).

Range Emergency Response Plan
